intro: Rubus convexifolius, commonly known as the convex-leaf blackberry, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to the eastern United States and is characterized by its distinctive, thickly hairy leaves with a convex shape. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
